text.section: In accordance with this section, the Commission may charge reasonable and nondiscriminatory fees for the filing of documents with the Commission and for other services performed by the Commission.

section.section: In determining the amount of a fee to be charged for a filing or other service performed by the Commission, the Commission shall consider the estimated expense associated with the filing or other service.
The Commission shall waive a fee charged under this section for a filing by a unit of State government or for a service performed by the Commission for a unit of State government.
The Commission may waive a fee charged under this section if the Commission determines that the waiver is in the public interest.

text.section: A document for which a filing fee is required may be received by the Commission at any time, but may not be considered filed until the filing fee has been paid.
The Commission shall deposit all fees collected under this section in the Public Utility Regulation Fund.
The Commission shall adopt regulations to set reasonable and nondiscriminatory fees for filing and other services performed by the Commission.
